content: what are we making today treasure piles today I'm going to show
you a really easy way to make treasure piles that will match the cave tiles
that we built in episode 1 the first thing we're going to do is make these
little bases on washers and that technique you can take and use on any
sort of item you want we're going to use it on treasure today but you want to do
crystals you want to do little pushes you want to do whatever this is a really
simple easy way to make bases that match those cave tiles already a lot of videos
on making treasure piles so some of this you may already know but I do have at
least one cool little trick up my sleeve that I haven't seen in any other videos
so hopefully it'll be new for you and you'll like it
and yeah let's make gold ok grab a 1 inch washer I like to put some tape on
the back this stops your glue from going through the center hole and gives the
base a softer surface than the metal so you don't damage your train
next cover the washer in hot glue this will build up some texture and give you
a better surface to bond to in the next step cover the entire area in full
strength PVA glue now completely cover in place and tap off the excess and let
the glue dry completely before painting and here I've painted the base using the
same technique as the cave tiles in episode 1 grab some gold glitter I
prefer the coarser type as I think it looks a little bit more like coins you
may also want to add some jewels I got this assortment of sizes and colors at
Michaels they were very cheap maybe 3 bucks for the whole case but they aren't
the highest quality if you want a more realistic and reflective jewel get the
ones that why lock uses in his treasure pile tutorial here I spread some tacky
glue and start placing the jewels I found that tacky glue is easier to
work with when placing these tiny little items but if you don't have any on hand
normal PVA glue will work just fine once you're happy with your jewel
placement cover the whole thing in glitter don't be shy come on there you
go just shake off the excess and you have
yourself a very nice-looking treasure pile the last step is a protective
coating my secret weapon clear nail polish just by yourself the cheapest
stuff you can get at the dollar store cover the entire pile this will add some
nice shine but more importantly it will lock in all that glitter and make the
pile rock hard keeping it looking good for a really long time even if you throw
these in a bin full of other train and minis alright that's a nice easy project
complete if you enjoyed the vid please go and hit subscribe also you can like
black magic craft on Facebook to keep updated on various projects I'm working
on and if you have any requests for tutorials go ahead and post them in the
comments if it's something cool I'll probably build it this video was a
request see you in the next one pressure
